controlsTable.averageEffect.title: Effect
controlsTable.averageEffect: Expected reduction in averaged cost of cyber incidents
controlsTable.highEffect: Expected reduction in annual cost of cyber incidents in a high loss year (with 1% exceedance probability)
controlsTable.currentMinimum.title: Current Minimum
controlsTable.currentMinimum: This is the current minimum state of a security control. It takes into account different levels of implementation across an organization and considers the lowest level of implementation for quantification purposes.
controlsTable.targetMinimum.title: Target Minimum
controlsTable.targetMinimumISO.title: Target
controlsTable.targetMinimum: The new level of controls across all asset groups after mitigation recommendations are taken.
controlsTable.currentControlScore.title: Current Control Score
controlsTable.currentControlScore.info: The average control score of all asset groups in the company
controlsTable.uponCompleting.title: Upon Completing Action
controlsTable.averageReduction.title: Average Reduction
controlsTable.highReduction.title: High Reduction
controlsTable.actions.title: Implementation Steps

damageTypes.title: Damage Types
damageTypes.description: Average loss breakdown of the risk by damage types.

lostIncome.title: Lost Income
lostIncome.description: Financial impact resulting from the interruption of business operations due to a cyber event.

biForensics.title: Business Interruption Forensics
biForensics.description: Costs of investigation and analysis required to determine the cause and extent of a cyber event.

biRecoveryExpenses.title: Business Interruption Recovery Expenses
biRecoveryExpenses.description: Costs associated with restoring normal operations after a cyber event.

publicRelationsRepairment.title: Public Relations Repairment
publicRelationsRepairment.description: Costs associated with restoring public trust and mitigating reputational damage following a cyber event.

extortionPayment.title: Extortion Payment
extortionPayment.description: Financial cost incurred when paying a ransom to regain access to compromised systems or data.

extortionRecoveryExpenses.title: Extortion Recovery Expenses
extortionRecoveryExpenses.description: Financial cost incurred when paying a ransom to regain access to compromised systems or data.

legalDefense.title: Legal Defense
legalDefense.description: Costs associated with legal proceedings and defense efforts following a data breach event.

settlements.title: Settlements
settlements.description: Costs incurred in legal settlements or agreements resulting from a data breach event.

dataRecovery.title: Data Recovery
dataRecovery.description: Efforts to retrieve and restore compromised or encrypted data following a cyber event.

monitoringServices.title: Monitoring Services
monitoringServices.description: Costs incurred by the company to monitor systems, networks, or data for signs of compromise or suspicious activity following a cyber event.

notifications.title: Notifications
notifications.description: Costs associated with notifying affected individuals about a data breach or security incident.

dataRelatedForensics.title: Data Related Forensics
dataRelatedForensics.description: Expenses required to investigate, analyze, and identify compromised data to determine the cause, extent, and impact of a data compromise event.

regulatoryLegalDefense.title: Regulatory Legal Defense
regulatoryLegalDefense.description: Expenses incurred to defend against regulatory actions and investigations following a data breach event.

regulatoryFines.title: Regulatory Fines
regulatoryFines.description: Financial penalties imposed by regulatory bodies for non-compliance with data protection laws and regulations following a cyber event.

attritional.title: Attritional
attritional.description: Expected, recurring, or ongoing losses that a company may face due to common and frequent cyber incidents. These losses can derive from unsuccessful phishing attempts, low profile data breaches with limited data exposure, or minor cybersecurity incidents that are quickly addressed.

quotaExceeded.title: Quota Exceeded
quotaExceeded.description: You've exceed the amount of free quantified scenarios allowed on your tenant. If you'd like to upgrade, please inquire through contact@kovrr.com

demo.addScenario: Want to add a new risk scenario?

labels.likelihoodInformation: The probability of this risk scenario occurring, rated from Rare to Expected.
labels.impactInformation: The potential severity of damage if this risk scenario occurs, rated from Negligible to Severe.
labels.annualLikelihoodInformation: The estimated probability as a percentage that this scenario will occur within the next year.
labels.peerBaseRateInformation: The average annual likelihood of this risk scenario occurring across organizations in your industry. This benchmark helps contextualize your risk assessment against industry trends.
labels.averageLossInformation: The estimated average financial impact per occurrence, including direct and indirect costs.
labels.initialAccessVectorsInformation: Define the initial access vectors for your custom cyber risk scenario. Initial access vectors represent the ways in which potential threats could gain entry to your organization's systems.
labels.crqEventTypesInformation: Define the type of event triggered by this scenario. Event types describe the nature of the cyber incident and how it unfolds within your organization.
labels.crqImpactTypesInformation: Define the specific type of impact this scenario could have on your organization's assets and operations.
labels.impactMagnitudeDescription: Specify the scale of the scenario's impact on your organization.

99.information:
For example:
Early detection of a phishing attempt, a few employees received suspicious emails, but no actual harm was done.

75.information:
For example:
A single employee's account was breached, non-sensitive data was leaked, requiring an internal security review.

50.information:
For example:
Data breach affecting user records in a CRM system, requiring regulatory reporting and initial legal expenses.

25.information:
For example:
A widespread phishing attack compromised financial systems, resulting in critical business data loss and external investigation.

1.information:
For example:
Large-scale customer data leak, legal lawsuits, heavy regulatory fines, and significant reputational damage.

dataBreachPhishing.editControls: Want to edit the relevant controls?
dataBreachPhishing.title: Data breach due to phishing attack
dataBreachPhishing.description: Employees fall victim to phishing emails, leading to sensitive data exposure
dataBreachPhishing.peerBaseRateDescription: The average annual likelihood of this risk scenario occurring across organizations in your industry. This benchmark helps contextualize your risk assessment against industry trends.
dataBreachPhishing.impactDistributionDescription: A statistical breakdown of potential financial losses. Shows the range of possible impact amounts and their probabilities, from minimum (1%) to maximum (99%) loss scenarios. Helps understand the full spectrum of potential financial outcomes.
dataBreachPhishing.aalLikelihoodDescription: The estimated likelihood as a percentage that this scenario will occur within the next 12 months.
dataBreachPhishing.averageFinancialLossDescription: The estimated average financial impact per occurrence, including direct and indirect costs.
dataBreachPhishing.metricAverageFinancialLossDescription: The expected financial impact if this cyber risk scenario materializes.
dataBreachPhishing.metricAnnualEventsLikelihoodDescription: The estimated likelihood of cyber loss events occurring within the next 12 months, based on the selected risk scenario.
dataBreachPhishing.crqPoweredScenario: This is a CRQ Powered Scenario
dataBreachPhishing.scenarioDescription: All the metrics below are retrieved from the quantification of {{companyName}} run at {{fqDate}}.
dataBreachPhishing.rerunScenario: Want to rerun the CRQ scenario?
dataBreachPhishing.scenarioRobustnessDescription: Reflects the strength of the underlying data behind your selected scenario.
dataBreachPhishing.matchCountInfo: The percentage of damage-causing events in the simulation that match this scenario's characteristics. Attritional events (small, non-specific losses) are excluded. A higher Match Count means a larger sample was used to calculate average costs. Low values may reduce accuracy. This metric also underlies the scenario's Annual Likelihood calculation.<FormulaTag>(Number of matching events with damage / Total simulated events with damage) × 100</FormulaTag>
dataBreachPhishing.diversityScoreInfo: Shows how many unique event combinations (e.g., vector, type, impact, data, duration, cost) are represented within this scenario compared to all possible combinations. Higher scores indicate broader scenario coverage across risk dimensions.<FormulaTag>(Unique combinations in the scenario / 6,912 total possible combinations) × 100</FormulaTag>
dataBreachPhishing.updateSuccessDescription: The CRQ scenario was updated successfully.
